column5: No ling - we didn't get much fishing done after the storm set in as it was really hectic trying to prevent everything from blowing away - a big thanks to Nick and Jason for helping and saving my clam from blowing away.  My cousin's shelter ended up blowing away.  It was anchored in well but all 4 ropes ripped off and left the anchors in the ice - that's how strong the wind was.  Luckily we found it the next morning (thank you Jason for helping me look!).  I was 100% sure my tent would go too even though I anchored it really well, I am still surprised it didn't blow away.  I was afraid to even try opening it - because I knew as soon as I opened a door it would kite up and be gone.  Kevin, thank you for providing accommodation, I am certain many more things would have been blown away if it wasn't for you.   It's my cousin's.  Setting it up yourself is hard but very easy with two people. It's easily roomy enough for two people to fish in, I think it's a fine shelter under at least close to normal circumstances.  I can't even really blame the manufacturer for the ropes ripping and it flying away either - those wind gusts were by far the strongest I have ever seen on the ice and I don't think any portable would stand up to them.
Breath deeply. Become the bait.You are the bait. Raise your head to the heavens and repeat after me.  HERE FISHY FISHY FISHY FISHY !!!!!!!!!!!!
I just tuned in on this one ... wow!... this is better then the wide world of sports , gona keep an eye on this one for sure today and see how every one makes out ...... Awsome .

I just got home. Last thing I did was drive NAW and Livinfishing from the shack to shore, to pick up some gear. By they opened the door, a full blizzard had set in! I drove them back to the shack as a courtesy move,.. Should be an interesting night for them and Lota Lota.  Full report tomorrow.. Right now I'm off to kick out some jams for the night.

too bad we couldn't get out to your area and meet everyone. We ended up I don't know where. Roughly 4km from our huts but was told we could see an island and beyond was Callender Bay  we did well with some nice jumbo perch, walleye, and two good size whitefish. Fished in about 49FOW. have to say the whitefish is very good.

awesome time had by all, very few fish but i think it was fun day on the ice anyway! when we left the boys were getting set up for the night, then the phone call came that lota lotas tent and belongings were spread over callander bay!!!!!!hope everyone is ok! thanks to blair and chad for putting together another great day!!!

Short report as I did not take many of the pictures. Rod Caster was the camera man.  As of 6pm there were at least 6 walleye caught, biggest being 23". 3 pike, biggest being 25". 4 herring, biggest being 16.5". 8-10 perch, biggest being 10.5".  Here is a lunch time group shot. Rod Caster (Chad), Spud7378 (Kevin), Livinisfishin (Jason), Fishman2202 (Alexander), Motion (Tony), East Luther (Jay). Hot dogs and hamburgers on the bar-b-que.   Trouty (Ryan), Wormdunker (Brian), and Brian    Lota Lota (Dan) and his cousins acomodations pre wind-storm.    Joey Tier    Spud7378 (Kevin) in his hut.    Duckdog (Nelson)'s set up with his son Carter (both inside).    Motion (Tony) and his son Fishman2202 (Alexander)'s set ups.    Rod Caster will provide fishing pictures.

Hey guys thanx for a wonderful day.  It was nice to meet all the members whom I had only know previously as posters on the board.  Weather was great, fishing was good.  My buddy from London ( Brian) got skunked which is good for me.  I outfished him by 1 pike 19.5".  if it wern't for Alex nailing 3 walleye in less than 30 minutes I wouldn't have gotten any excercise, running to see his fish!  Blair U R the best for organizing this event.  Thanx for sharing your shack to warm up in. A big thank U to the OFNers who supplied the hot dogs & burgers.  My ride to the LCBO with the ATV was awesome.  U can drive an ATV on the streets in Callandar.  In my town U get arrested! Randy from Sturgeon - I did blow the horn while cruising thru Sturgeon Falls.  Why didn't U wave?  Blair What did U do with my cheesies & pretzels?  I'm hungry now!  Tired, going to bed
great time guys, we had a blast my son is still up talking about his big fish :-) had a blast
Looks like a great day was had by all Looking forward to more pics
Yup, more pics would be good
my son is still bragging about the screwdriver, thank you much mercman

Well that was a fun ride back home! It took us over four hours of driving through hell to get home. White-outs, two conga lines and tons of blowing snow. Well at least we made it back in one piece. I'm dead tired, mainly from running back and forth to my son Alexander's hut to help him with his many fish.  We had a blast today fishing and meeting all the guys that showed up for the GTG. Special thanks to Blair for organizing the event and for meeting up with us yesterday to do some late afternoon perch fishing. Thanks to Chad as well for helping us though out the day.  Hope we can do this again next year!  Cheers.
Nick and Dan! Did you get blown out to Sturgeon Falls last night? How'd it go? Any Ling?

I would not have wanted that drive, man I left Blairs shack and he volunteered to drive with us the make sure me and my son go back to the park, good job I had a gps, visibility was maybe 10feet, it came up instantly, we went in the shack to say thanks and then I had the shack door ripped out of my hand with my guess 50kms winds, glad to see you made it home ok :-)
Who owns that clam? I was looking at one today.

Thanks. Ya it was a wild storm alright. I had over 300km to travel and most of the first part of it we were crawling at 30-40km/hr. It seemed to come in waves but we were able to pick up some speed further south. Now a day of rest before I get back to the bump and grind.......
Brian, that Clam hub is Lota Lota (Dan's).
Thanks

that clam is Lota Lota's cousin.  They found it on the shore this morning!  It went for a ride last night.  Thanks Blair for letting us use the hut.  Radio said the winds where 90kmh.  I believe it.  Nice big drift around your hut now.  The fishing wasn't really fast, but ended the weekend with 3 perch, 3 herring, 2 walleye, 1 pike, and 1 LING..    It wasn't the giant that I wanted, but it made it all worth while!  Managed to squeak by Alexander by one fish to take the "most fish" price.  Split the pot with Trouty, who got the biggest fish with a decent pike.  Here's your half of the price Trouty..  A pile of change adding up to $13, and a hand full of lures!   Tagged a walleye first thing in the morning while packing up..   Or if your prefer this pose   And Dinner for tonight, and lunch for tomorrow..   It was awesome to meet everyone!  Thanks again for the Jack last night Lota Lota.  And thanks for the company Jason!  The drive home was sketchy, but we made it
Good haul Nick. That walleye you caught this morning is huge! At least in the 2nd picture  . Looks like Trouty gets his plastics back.

Mercman thanx for donating some prizes.  Motion, we (Brian & Brian) had similar driving to get to Sudbury, storm came out of no where.  To my knowledge not even forecasted, but north of Sudbury they had a severe blizzard with 15 CM of snow.  This AM was beautiful on Nepawassi Lake.  Let's do it again next season.  It was a blast.
Glad everyone had a great time!!! Maybe next year I'll get there..
Hoping U were gonna "Drop in".  Ice was perfect for a landing strip
Ya but it would have been fun to watch him take off in that storm   Would have been great to see you Wayne, but you made the right call staying put. Hope to see you next year.
not that rough frozen slush crap... if I was sure it was frozen solid it would have been wheels down, not skis!  Maybe next year.... might work it in on a trip North to fish real waters! LOL

I wish I could.... my wife doesn't know his and my kids don't know theirs...  we are of different cultures (I'm French Scot Canadian and he's Pakistani Croatian) , he's in the Navy and spends 200+ days on the water but has never been on the ice and swears that he never will...  I really don't like unexpected expected company....  I was really looking forward to tomorrow.   Randy
I just purchased 8 burgers and buns.  Also got a pound of butter ... Now who is bringing the salted minnows, they sound delicious!
I am bringing 8 burgers and buns also, as well as a pretty big iron frying pan.  Getting really excited!

I drove right to the hut this morning. I drove onto the ice and parked close to the dock.    I walked to the hut with my gear then walked back to the truck drilling holes ever 200-400 feet. Here are some pictures to show ice quality and depth. I found varying ticknesses between 12.5" and 16.5". I then drove the truck to the hut then back off with out issue. Slush is all hardened and should make for better fishing.  Video          The drive
Do you have a gaff at the hut?  I lost mine last year.  Just picked up all the parts to make a new one, but not sure if I have the time to complete the task tonight.  I don't have a welder..
Yep. there is a gaff in the hut.
Nick, You are not going to catch anything anyways so don't worry about a gaff...
Only took me 3hrs to make
Good luck   to all tomorrow This shaping up to be a great event... if it wasn't so far, I'd drop by in a heart beat    May be someday Again good luck to all!!! Leechman

OK so you're all C&R guys and you use barbless hooks but you need a gaff???  Have the greatest time. Sounds like you'll all have a blast. All of us shut-ins will really appreciate a report...please please take tons of pics and write a few reports. That'd be great!
I'm all packed and ready to go.  Going to try to make it for ~8:00 tomorrow but it depends on how the drive will be from Mississauga.  I'll be the guy in the grey Armada.  See you all tomorrow!
C&R??  The gaff is for the GIANT ling that I'm going to catch!  Lobster for dinner on Nippissing tomorrow night!

Hey guys we are here also in our hut.  SLOW tonight. Any tips? What are you guys using? We got the usual glow in the dark, minnows, jigs, rapala jigging raps, etc.  Need to get the skunk out.  I also drove out in my van and unloaded. thick ice everywhere, but chickened out and then parked back at the lot off Birchgrove
South Shore eh? My guess is you are not deep enough. Make sure you are 25-40 fow and you'll find everything.
If you feel like taking a mid-afternoon drive come see us.
Looks like something my 8 year old did.

hey sounds like a good time.  Leaving Sudbury at 7:00 am.  Be on the ice 9:00 am.  if u don't know who I am, I'll have the biggest fish.   HA HA, I wish??  I'm bringing  chips, pretzels, cheesies.  1 more sleep!!!!
Beep your horn on the way by ....
OK   BEEEEP  BEEEP!!
Lota Lota, NAW and Livinfishin here so far! Gonna be good!
Trying to get my little guy ready lol, should be there in 45mins
Motion and his son are on the ice too. I'm still at the landing greeting members
Have a great time guys!
Thanks for the tip Nipfisher. Our hut is over 28fow. Our operator is going to take us out after lunch to another spot. I'll see if I can get him to drop by your place too.  cheers
Nick is holding a strong lead right now. A pike a four herring. Blair has biggest fish with a decent pike. One small perch for me... At least my lures will be nice and clean
I have had no need for chains at all yet, I get fit them on the tires I have anyways lol

best to park at the park just down the road, there is a parking lot just down the road towards North Bay with way more parking but if your walking it will be quite the walk, depending on what times I am there I can give a few rides
What?  I can't get out with the truck? I have a lot of stuff to bring, pic-nic table, BBQ, gear... Are there 2 ices again?  Randy
Holy moly, going to be at least twice the turnout from last year.  Can't wait!

Yup. From what I saw yesterday, the slush layer hasn't completely frozen yet. If it were -20 tonight, we'd be ok.  I found a brand new mepps deep diver for the derby box! A twoonie gets you in the derby and if you can add a new or gently used lure or anything small and fishing related, then you get a big ol' handshake along with derby rights.
I cleaned up one of my customized williams ice jiggin spoons.  Caught me many a Simcoe whitefish.
Chad, do I have to shake your hand?
You already did... first time we met. Ha!
Nice. Anybody would be happy with that lure...and it comes with history and luck!

I'm going to pack to walk out, but hopefully it will be driveable by Saturday morning.  I have a lot of stuff but since there is no snow on the ice judging by the pictures, dragging it shouldn't be too hard.

I plan on dragging a load out in the morning with fishing gear.  The a second load in the afternoon with sleeping / Dinner stuff.  If you need a hand dragging stuff, just grab me, I'll give you a hand.
Hmm, after just reading the post by kickingfrog in the other thread, I think I'm better off playing it safe and just walking out.
Thanks, I should be OK but if anything I will let you know.  I do have my little cousin to drag stuff out for me just in case though

I will drive out towards the hut tomorrow and post a report. There is varying ice but from where I have drilled it is all 11" -15" of good ice. The probalem has been the slush. One option for us could be parking on the ice at the bottom of the launch. There are some deep ruts but all trucks would make it down. I will drill several holes tomorrow and take pictures.  It will be 100% drive at your own risk....I will provide the info and if you are comfortable then you choose to drive.

Blair, I picked up a bag of big hot dogs and 24 large hot dog buns from Costco for Saturday's lunch. I'll give you a call when we arrive in North Bay tomorrow afternoon. Hope you can get away for a bit to get in some late afternoon fishing.  Got a couple of new lures for the derby and some "famous" small screwdrivers from Mercman (Paul) that I was asked to bring as well.  Talk  to you tomorrow.  Tony
K. Tony, I hope to put you guys on sme jumbos tomorrow night. Any locals interested in a short fish at the waterfront from 4-6 ish?
Forecast is now adjusted to 10 km/h winds from the South. GTG forecast
Thanx Nip but I just like to go riding.  Never had a new ATV riding is fun!  Bought chains let's givr
O.k. you can be the taxi.
I'm good to go!  If any one needs a ride please flag me down.  I'm green Polaris, black suit with some white stripes
Just bought the chains tonight, gotta try em out!  Hey Nip if U don't like the chains, your ride will be crazy!! LOL sorry had to be funny
Nice and warm.  12" of ice. I think I'll leave the floater suite home, and just bring the old plad jacket.
Good dry boots and cleats....yes......but no floater suit required.

Just got a text from an old friend from Halifax who is moving to Victoria ( navy ) he was supposed to spend the night here tomorrow and leave Sunday.... He's leaving Ottawa with his family at around noon today... And will be here early this evening...... So unfortunately the only fishing I will get done will be from my couch on WFN...   Have fun out there gang!!!  Randy
That is too bad Randy. Go for a long coffee run in the morning and say hi. Bring your buddy for the ride.
Maybe I should try to borrow this one from my Dad!
Sounds like a good time.How is the weather ,ice conditions.
You'll be out there longer than I, you may as well bring yours.  I'll bring a stick of butter so we can cook up some daytime perch
Welcome to OFC Fishingfamer.  Blair has been give regular updates on the ice conditions.  Just read a little further back in this thread.

I will provide the condiments, and a case of water.  Rod Caster will bring hot dog buns, and water.  Spud7378 is bringing weiners, and peperettes.  Motion is bringing hot dog buns and weiners.  NAW is bringing 8 burgers and buns.  Livinisfisn will bring cheese slices and some pop/juice.  Duckdog is bringing the portable bar-b-que (tank is at the hut but no hose). He will also have his ATV with him for rides in / out.  Lota Lota will bring another pack of burgers and buns.
Ill bring my hose and 5lb ttank just in case
Gunna have to get roof racks for the Fusion
bin awhile since I used the portable bbq, I think it takes 1lb tanks but I have the adpater so where set, so long we dont get 40kms winds lol, I will try to grab some pop, as I dont drink
Haha more room in it compared to my old tribute! Screw roof racks I think we are going to need a trailer!

I see 25km winds on the weathernet work?  High of -2  WOO HOO!  Hey Nip, how deep is the water at your hut?  Have the perch been cooperating lately?  Looking forward to Saturday.  I see there is lots of food & drinks being brought.  I'd like to donate as well.  What do U need?

I just posted about making a decision on purchasing an ice finder.  Is anybody attending the GTG that has a humminbird Ice 55 or Showdown.  Would love it if someone would show me how to operate it.  I hate reading manuals!  Also, I will probably purchase it Thurs or Fri after work.  Therefore I won't have extra time to learn to operate it.  3 more sleeps  WOO HOO  Thanx

Just bring a couple bags of chips or snacks. Hut is over 13 feet of water. We will fish an area from 11 - 16 fow. Perch have been active using smaller presentations and small minnows. Hopefully the fish cooperate and keep us busy. Pike have been plentiful around my hut this year. We have caught at least 1 walleye almost every time we have been there. Most guys doing well are 25-30 feet of water for walleye but would have been too far to have people walk out for the gtg.

I use a Lowrance HDS-5 with the PPP-1 accessory (portable power pack) for ice fishing and also use it on my boat all year. They are expensive units but can be used all year round. Also Terry will tell you they are AWESOME.
Don't forget to bring a twooney and a small gift (eg. Lure) for the derby! Biggest fish and most fish split the pot.
Is TJ coming with a box full of goodies again?  If he is, I would love to buy an OFC toque from him??
Unfortunately T.J. will not be able to attend this year. Maybe P.M. him about the toque Nick.

Drove out a little ways today, just past the end of the dock and rounded the corner towards the hut. Lots of ice but still breaking through the top layer and into the slush. It has tightened up around the hut and will be good for Sat. BRING CLEATS!

Thanks for the update... things might freeze up nicely over the next two days, but I don't think I'll be driving to your shack this year. Heel-toe express for me  My Dad and I just returned from a 4wheeler trip towards deeper water. We may have broken through the top crust a couple times; overall the ice is  suitable for a 4wheeler, not a snowmobile or truck. We caught one keeper walleye and missed two. 42fow. We just randomly picked a spot since we didn't bring the GPS.  edited to add : top crust
After returning to the parking lot I walked out and with no snow on the hard surface with no sleigh to pull it was a 3 minute walk.
Hey Nip  Add 1 to your list.  My buddy from London is coming.  His name is Brian, I'm Brian also,& also we R both crane operators. I'll bring chips, pretzels, as suggested earlier

mmmmmm.. Pretzels.....   I just spend 2 hours in the garage getting my gear packed for this weekend.  Anyone else PUMPED for the NIP G2G!  I have to thank Blair, and all the other North Bay'rs (Chad, Randy, Kevin, Joey...) for the hospitality!  This is officially an annual thing for me.
It will only get better Nick. Maybe we will do South Shore one year for better walleye.
I'm picking up a set of chains tonight for my ATV.  Ice everywhere here in Sudbury
Brian, it is such a short drive to my hut you woint need them. Actually you don't NEED to trailer your quad here at all.

Looks like I'm likely gonna be joining you guys for this. 25km/h winds, I may need to drag the shack along. One question though Nipfisher, Is there any place to park other than the few spots near the Chief? I've only parked over there once before and didn't notice any other areas to park.
3 pike and 2 perch while building a fort and wrestling with my boys yesterday. Was not about the fishing lol.
Hey Nipfisher, What shape is the lake in? really slushy?

Around my hut is really good actually. There are some deep pockets of slush around Sunbeam Bungalows and the launch areas (from traffic). Yesterday was the best I have seen it. Today's plus temps and rain may make it a little slushy.  Last 2 days we have walked out the launch and accross the front of the dock / island where it is packed from sleds and 4-wheelers. Makes for a minute or 2 longer walk but lots easier.

Hey Blair, we are confirmed for the GTG! Please add my son (and fellow OFNer) fishman2202 to your list. He may be young, but he'll most likely kick some butt if he gets on to fish.  Let me know what we can bring for the GTG. (PM sent) Looking forward to seeing all the gang on Saturday.  Cheers!

Alright. Lets keep this on the 1st page. It is less then a week away!  Here is the confirmed list thus far........  Nipfisher Rod Caster Joeytier Randy From Sturgeon NAW Livinisfishn Spud7378 Lota Lota BassAsin DuckDog Mike01 Wormdunker Locnar Motion fishman2202 East Luther    If you are not on this list and coming for sure please let me know.  If you are still "trying" to come....keep trying.   I know spud has his dad and some buddies coming. I have invited a few guys too. Looks like we will have about 20 anglers with at least 15 members.  Let's get the food figured out. Burgers and hot dogs are easiest. I'll provide all the condiments, and a case of water. We need people to commit to bring chips, buns, weiners, and burgers.  Ideas?????
If the 40K wind is correct.. you wont see me fella!
I've got a box of 8 burgers and a bag of 8 buns.  I can bring those.
SW 20 km/h is what I have seen. I'll cross my fingers.   I'll let you use my HDS-5 Wayne.
Great Nick. Maybe there will be enough left-overs for breakfast.
Current is 20 SW there.. 40 SW here.. and a lot of "bumps" in between. Who knows what it will really be in 6 days!
Hey Nipfisher,  I'm brining my cousin along as well.  Please let me know how I can help out with anything else.  I don't have a portable BBQ but would be glad to help out with food etc.
How about bringing a couple bags of chips or dorritos?
Hey, Blair!  Finally got on to the forum, add my name. I will only be stopping in for a quick visit.  Cheers,  Jay
WELCOME Jay.
Woo hoo! 4 more days.  I'll be at the landing at 8am to meet the early-birds, black mazda truck with an OFC sticker on it. Blair will arrive some time around 9.
My son (fishman2202) and I will be at the landing on Saturday morning to meet up with you at 8:00 AM. We will be in the black Ranger looking lost.........  Cant wait to see all of you Saturday!

Wel after the + temps. and rain here is what Callander Bay looked like today. It was slushy today but according to the forecast it will tighten up for the gtg. I think we will need ice cleats.      You can see my white hut (brown door) in front of the island.
still easy going on the atv, must have missed you out there, we (me and the little guy) went for a quick ride to check it out

Doesn't look too bad! With the -15 tonight and the low of -9 on Wednesday, it should tighten up a bit!  Will be up with the wife Thursday at 12:00 and the rest of the gang (2 other couples) show up Thursday evening, and fish until Monday morning! Can't wait!!!!  Cheers,  EL
It was a bit soft today but it will be better for Sat. Might be slippery though.
Cleats........check.  I'll just keep adding to the list. Let me know if you want us to bring anything special. I was thinking to grab some hot dogs and buns for the BBQ.
Sounds good Tony.
Do you have a frying pan in the shack blair? I could bring a stick of butter
There is only a small cast iron frying pan in the hut.
I have a pretty big solid one and can bring it if needed.

Good work Nip for organizing this event.  What time do U plan to be there?  I'm going to be there unless work gets in the way.  I'll check your posts for final plans.  Pls post whether U will have minnows.  This would help me out, save looking for a bait shop.  No problem kicking in $$$.

My guess is some people will arrive between 7:30 and 9. We "kicked off" at 9 am last year. Last year I was able to purchase bulk shiners in pounds I have requested again so I will find out. I am sure the locals can adrerss the bait need if my supplier doesn't come through.

Are we doing a little derby like we did last year?  If I remember correctly it was a $10 buy in (maybe $5?).  Biggest Fish, and Most fish split the pot, and get first dibs at the OFC gear box that TJ dropped off  That was fun last year
I'll gladly pitch in a lure or two for such a derby
Don't expect a repeat!  I may not be hungover this time.  Watch out!
I think you might be missing the point of a GTG, sir.
No I'm not, don't worry.
Nick, I think this is what we did......from last years thread.......   We also need to set some derby rules.
How about a twoonie and a lure?   I'm gonna jig me up a 10lbs ling this year... watch out boys!
Prize for the shortest "spot" landing !!
I'll make sure to have some cold pop for you Wayne. I may have a beer or five but I'm not flying home.   Not driving either lol.
R.C., I'll leave the derby up to you. One less thing for me to arrange.

In that case, let's do a "deuce and a lure" for the derby prizes. I'll bring a box and a few things to ante up the prize pool. Blairs suggestion works for me; most fish and biggest fish split the pot. If your attending, try to bring something like a jigging spoon, jig heads, hooks etc to pitch into the prize pool but no hard feelings if you happen to forget. Old minnows don't count as a prize. Haha. ..And the derby organizer CAN participate! I'm predicting a pre-hooked 10lbs ling on my third line takes all...
Not to sound cheap, but can I throw in a new lure, that's out of the box, or should we have all new in the box lures?  I have some nice customize ice jiggin spoons I can throw in.
I was thinking that too... Old lure, unused lure, opened box..as long as its not a rusty, hookless chunk of lead (unless a sinker), the prize pool will accept it!

On my way to the hut right now.    I have just confirmed that I will recieve a pound and a half of shiners on the 28th at 8am. It will work out to about 11-12 dozen minnows. I will collect at the hut. No need to bring your own as I have more at my hut too.    Thank you to Discount Bait and Tackle for the great deal on the shiners. I will have a second person with me so I can transport them legally.
Should have a good report come Sunday. Gonna spend Sat night out there.
Nice! Lingfest! Will u be there during prime time tonight? I might want to come for a visit
Sounds like a good time. I will see if I can make it up there this year.
That would be awesome Dann.

Alright. Lets keep this on the 1st page. It is less then a week away! Here is the confirmed list thus far........  Nipfisher Rod Caster Joeytier Randy From Sturgeon NAW Livinisfishn Spud7378 Lota Lota BassAsin DuckDog Mike01 Wormdunker Locnar Motion Trouty   If you are not on this list and coming for sure please let me know.  If you are still "trying" to come....keep trying.    We need to figure out food. Doesn't look like we will be able to drive on the lake so a bar-b-que is out of the question. Anyone have a habatchi or portable bar-b-que?
Do u have a banner/ sign to help people find U?
I have a portable bbq I can bring

If u follow Nipfishers photos (earlier in post) you should be able to find us quite easily. He's really not that far from the parking area...look left, see island with wood stairs, other side is Blairs shack.
We are all going to meet in the parking area at 9am. If you are late....follow the picture directions. either side of the island will get you to my hut.
I'l put in another day at the hut tomorrow with a forecasted high of 0 the bite should be on.
I'm gonna see if I can swing this
Would be great to have you join us Dan.
I'd love to make this event but alas it won't be this year.  Maybe next year and we'll car pool Dan.
Sounds good to me
any one see nick (NAW) on the news last night!!!! hes famous!!!

BBBBBAAAAAAHHHHHAAAAAAHHHHAAAAAA...  How'd you know it was me!?  http://www.ctvbarrie.ca/category/news/  Story starts around 4:20..Jan 15 Webcast.  It's about the Volunteer Search and Rescue team I'm on.  Good group of people.  Most people Ontario don't even know we exist.

That's fantastic Nick.   The world can use a few more like you guys. Keep up the good work, but I hope I never need your help out there  My son and I are thinking of coming up to join you guys for the GTG. I hope we can make it so I can thank you in person!  Tony
i remember you from last year, we talked im the fire fighter

Spent 4 hours in the hut today but left before the evening bite. Managed 2 walleye, 3 pike, and 2 perch. I lost 3 fish and by the fight I am guessing one was a monster walleye that hit a 3" sucker minnow. I also lost what I'm guessing is a heavy pike as I hit the ice at the bottom of the hole and knocked it free.    Good to see the pike and perch cooperating during the day with the odd walleye mixed in. Biggest pike I got today was 28" and the little walleye I kept was about 12.5". Also kept one 10" perch.      When we get our holes drilled and it looks like swiss cheese we should have a productive day. I talked to a bait shop today about getting a pound and a half or 2 pounds of shiners. They will let me know later this week.

Nipfisher posted this a few pages back:   Here is some Hotel/Motel info. for those staying over night and needing accomodations.   The closest hotel is Terrace Suites but that is alot of cash. My suggestion is one of these three places.  Arizona Motel 705-472-0800 1078 Lakeshore Drive North Bay, ON http://www.arizonamotelnorthbay.com/  The Lincoln Motel 705-472-3231 594 Lakeshore Drive North Bay, ON. http://www.lincolnmotel.net/  Glen Garry Motel 705-472-1085 785 Lakeshore Dr, North Bay ON,   All are less than 10 minutes from where we will be fishing and are affordable and comfortable.   I can arrange to get minnows if that makes it easier.   More info to follow.

One night from the 28th (Saturday) to the 29th.
I'm glad there will be a few others out there for the night.  What kind of tent are you using?  I've always wanted to try tenting it on the ice.  I'm looking forward to seeing your set up.

It's just a regular tent but it is a little lower and has a full canopy that goes all the way to the ground.  A full top+low is really the most important thing, beyond that, a warm sleeping bag.  My uncle actually owns a tent that is even better accustomed to winter camping, it's so low it would be difficult to even sit up properly for a big guy.  We'll decide later with my cousin which one to use.  The most important thing is the mats you use -- I have special thick ones.  Mat thickness isn't really something you want to mess around with as if it's too thin you can actually freeze some of your vitals.  Even with the thick mats I've seen that the snow under the tent melt a bit from where I was sleeping.  Anyway, I'd be glad to show you my set-up when I'm there.

After a short delay my hut will be on the ice tomorrow. I obtained some rigid plastic sheeting last week and decided I should renovate my hut for added warmth and comfort.  Here are some of the interior pics from last year with unfinished walls.       Here are some new pics from today that show the improovements. I recycled some fibreglass insulation and put in some vapour barrier. Then covered it with the plastic sheeting. My boys were the 1st to decorate the walls and rule is if you sign your name you have to draw a fish. Look at my 2.5 year olds fish above his name.

Callander Bay is the far east bay on Nipissing. Take highway 94 into Callander, turn on Main Street and the Government dock is off of Landsdowne. Blair,  Would it be possible for you to give a cumpas bearing from the boat launch where we parked last year, to your hut.  With a rough distance.  If I'm walking out from the parking lot, that would be the easiest way for me to find the place.

It is actually easier to find then last year.   When you walk out of the launch and get to the end of the dock, turn left (Heading South East). There is an island there with a big white platform on it. There used to be a light house on it but it blew down in a wind storm several years ago.  When you get to the island you are looking right at the door of my hut.  Here is an old picture of the lighthouse. My hut is almost exactly where the hut is in the picture.  Callander Bay Lighthouse  My guess is it would be less then 10 minutes to walk. Only a minute in the truck  .
If you don't attend how will you catch walleye like this? Rod Caster with a Callander Bay beast.     Here is the trick photography........
The walk from the landing is only 5 minutes.It is actually quicker to walk behind the Lighthouse island and come out on the other side.

With the ice finally forming on Lake Nipissing it is time to start organizing the 2nd annual OFC Lake Nipissing GTG. Last year we had about 15 members attend.  I am suggesting that we hold it the last weekend in January with the Saturday being the 28th. We will once again use my hut as the home base and fish around it.  I am willing to do all the organizing along with some assistance from my trusty sidekick Rod Caster.  We will arrange for the bar-b-que (Randy from Sturgeon?) and fire up some hot dogs, and hamburgs. I will try to assist anyone with finding sleeping accomodations at local hotels if needed.  I am trying to initiate the process for this year so comments regarding date or your ability to attend are welcome. If you are a North Bayite and want to assist it would be greatly appreciated.  Here is the confirmed list thus far........  Nipfisher Rod Caster Joeytier NAW Livinisfishn Spud7378 Lota Lota BassAsin DuckDog Mike01 Wormdunker Locnar Motion   Here is the 11 pages from last year. It was a great time. Nipissing Hardwater gtg

O.k. folks,  Here it is. I'm going to have my hut in a similar spot as it was last year only a little shallower so we should have more perch action.
